This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ADMIN-HEFCE.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-11T17:08:30Z Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-03-11T17:08:26+00:00 2015-03-11T17:08:26+00:00 Research to assess the nature and annual value of student start-ups https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;1da05670.1503 Research to assess the nature and annual value of student start-ups<br><br>A new report summarises exploratory research considering ways to provide evidence on the value of student enterprise, including student start-ups and the contribution of students to spin-outs, from English HEIs.<br><br>The findings confirm HEFCE's knowledge exchange funding supports student entrepreneurship and show that studying engineering and art and design-related subjects led to enterprise pathways in over half of start-ups. [...] Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-03-11T13:57:44+00:00 2015-03-11T13:57:44+00:00 Reminder: Quality assessment review plenary session in York on 20 March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;833102c8.1503 Reminder: Quality assessment review plenary session in York on 20 March 2015<br>In October 2014, the funding bodies in England, Wales and Northern Ireland announced that they were to jointly undertake a review of quality assessment arrangements.<br>HEFCE published and invited comments to the Quality Assessment Review Steering Group's (QARSG) discussion document in January/February 2015. A series of roundtable discussions have also been held to to discuss the high-level issues that will shape future quality assessment arrangements with the sector and other stakeholders.<br>As part of this first phase of sector engagement we are holding a quality assessment review plenary [...] Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-03-11T12:04:59+00:00 2015-03-11T12:04:59+00:00 Updated guidance for sponsors on applying for and renewing a Tier 4 sponsor licence https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;7d9c0815.1503 Updated guidance for sponsors on applying for and renewing a Tier 4 sponsor licence<br><br>UK Visas and Immigration have published updated guidance for sponsors on applying for and renewing a Tier 4 sponsor licence. This includes clarified guidance on how Tier 4 sponsor licences can be structured when working across multiple sites and campus locations and with partners when delivering higher education provision that we anticipate will be of interest to institutions. Transitional arrangements have been put in place for sponsors with existing Tier 4 licences to ensure they are compliant with the updated guidance, with action required in April/May [...] Shelley Hollingsworth (HEFCE) 2015-03-11T07:45:46+00:00 2015-03-11T07:45:46+00:00 Changes to the HEFCE website https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;2c59048e.1503 Today we have introduced some changes to our website. The main differences from the old site are:<br><br>* the design is new<br>* the main sections now reflect HEFCE's new business plan<br>* the layout and structure of pages has changed<br>* the site works better across different mobile devices.<br>The extranet is unaffected by these changes.<br>If your institution's website links to HEFCE's site there may be a need to update your site's pages. See below for a breakdown of the new locations and contact us at websitefeedback@hefce.ac.uk<mailto:websitefeedback@hefce.ac.uk> if you have any questions or feedback.<br>'Regulation' [...] Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-03-09T10:18:59+00:00 2015-03-09T10:18:59+00:00 Blog post: Opening the Secret Garden \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd a journey into tertiary education https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;53adf40b.1503 Blog post: Opening the Secret Garden \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd a journey into tertiary education<br><br>The Association of Colleges’ (AoC) annual HE conference is one of the main opportunities in the year to consider the important role college-based higher education plays within the HE system. In the months ahead of a general election \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd where the provision of higher technical skills and cost of higher education seem set to play a major part \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd this was an excellent opportunity to hear from experts in the field, and from politicians, on the likely shape of colleges’ contribution to tertiary education in the coming years. [...] Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-03-06T17:19:28+00:00 2015-03-06T17:19:28+00:00 Information published on the HEFCE web-site 2-6 March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;20107dad.1503 Information published on the HEFCE web-site 2-6 March 2015:<br><br>News<br>Project set to boost higher technical education in colleges across the country<http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,102089,en.html><br>The Association of Colleges has been awarded \ufffd\ufffd2.75 million by the HEFCE Catalyst Fund to enhance the learning of higher education students in colleges.<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,102089,en.html<br><br>Blog posts<br><br>The MENA University Summit<br>http://blog.hefce.ac.uk/2015/03/02/the-mena-university-summit/<br><br>Deadlines<br><br>8 April 2015 Nominations for a New Year 2016 Honour<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/pubs/year/2015/cl012015/ [...] Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-03-05T11:30:58+00:00 2015-03-05T11:30:58+00:00 Quality assessment review plenary session https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;e2db0302.1503 Quality assessment review plenary session<br>In October 2014, the funding bodies in England, Wales and Northern Ireland announced that they were to jointly undertake a review of quality assessment arrangements.<br>HEFCE published and invited comments to the Quality Assessment Review Steering Group's (QARSG) discussion document in January/February 2015. A series of roundtable discussions have also been held to to discuss the high-level issues that will shape future quality assessment arrangements with the sector and other stakeholders.<br>As part of this first phase of sector engagement we are holding a quality assessment review plenary session in York on 20 March 2015 [...] Shelley Hollingsworth (HEFCE) 2015-03-04T07:52:49+00:00 2015-03-04T07:52:49+00:00 BIS consultation: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAlternative Providers of Higher Education: Improving Quality and Value for Money\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd responses by 27 March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;97ec506a.1503 The Department for Business, Innovation and Skills (BIS) has issued a consultation ‘Alternative Providers of Higher Education: Improving Quality and Value for Money’.<br><br>The consultation asks about some key issues and will be of particular interest to HEFCE funded providers that deliver franchise provision in partnership with alternative providers.<br><br>Note that BIS is seeking responses by 27 March 2015. [...] Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-03-02T11:59:18+00:00 2015-03-02T11:59:18+00:00 Blog post: The MENA University Summit https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;d9d96c0b.1503 Blog post: The MENA University Summit<br><br>The title of oldest university in the world is a contested one, but both the Guinness Book of Records and UNESCO agree that the title goes to the University of al-Qarawiyyin in Morocco, which was founded in 859, some two centuries before the foundation of the University of Bologna. With this, and other ancient seats of learning, the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region has a rich history of higher education. Last week, leaders from universities in this region gathered in Doha, Qatar to consider one of the most recent trends in HE [...] p.foster@hefce.ac.uk 2015-02-27T14:56:57+00:00 2015-02-27T14:56:57+00:00 Information published on the HEFCE web-site 23-27 February 2015, and a forward look for March/April https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;e8779fd6.1502 Information published on the HEFCE web-site 23-27 February 2015:<br><br>News<br>Steve Egan appointed to senior post at the University of Bath<br>Steve Egan, Deputy Chief Executive and Director of Finance at HEFCE, has been appointed to the post of Vice-President (Implementation) at the University of Bath with effect from 1 May 2015.<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,101339,en.html<br><br>New HEFCE report shines further light on young participation in higher education<br>New HEFCE research looks at how many young people go on to higher education from A-levels and similar Level 3 qualifications.<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,101897,en.html [...] p.foster@hefce.ac.uk 2015-02-26T11:12:12+00:00 2015-02-26T11:12:12+00:00 STEM accreditation reviews launched https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;d04bcde9.1502 STEM accreditation reviews launched<br><br>The announcement of the Government's science and innovation strategy in December included a commission to establish a general review of science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) and a specific review of computer science degree accreditation arrangements. The reviews will explore issues around graduate employability and consider options for how they could be addressed. [...] p.foster@hefce.ac.uk 2015-02-26T09:12:58+00:00 2015-02-26T09:12:58+00:00 New HEFCE report shines further light on young participation in higher education https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;29cbb36b.1502 New HEFCE report shines further light on young participation in higher education<br><br>The report, 'Young participation in higher education: A-levels and similar qualifications' (HEFCE 2015/03), examines the rates of young participation in higher education for all Key Stage 5 pupils from English schools and colleges achieving a Level 3 qualification between 2006 and 2013. It also examines the extent to which a pupil's school and background affect their likelihood of progressing to higher education at the ages of 18 or 19. International student demand is showing strong signs of recovery. The numbers of EU students look positive, although levels are still below those in 2010. Demand from India seems to have levelled off at undergraduate level and there’s almost no change in student numbers from Pakistan. [...] Philip Purser-Hallard (HEFCE) 2015-02-18T11:00:34+00:00 2015-02-18T11:00:34+00:00 Global demand for English higher education: Latest shifts and trends https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;388bba86.1502 The latest international student enrolment figures show signs of recovery in global demand for English higher education. This report examines the latest shifts in enrolments of international students and aims to understand how sustainable the growth in demand is.<br><br>Read the report at http://www.hefce.ac.uk/pubs/year/2015/201502/<br><br>Anyone can join or leave <https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?SUBED1=admin-hefce&A=1> this list at any time. The tool will help prospective students identify questions to ask when deciding what and where to study, and to signpost them to sources of relevant information. [...] Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-02-16T10:16:37+00:00 2015-02-16T10:16:37+00:00 Blog post: How does the sector support student engagement and enhance students\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd learning experiences? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;49822128.1502 Blog post: How does the sector support student engagement and enhance students’ learning experiences?<br><br>Ellie Clewlow, HEFCE's Head of Learning and Teaching, reflects on discussions at a recent event for learning and teaching leaders and practitioners.<br><br>To read this post in full visit: http://blog.hefce.ac.uk/2015/02/16/how-does-the-sector-support-student-engagement-and-enhance-students-learning-experiences/ p.foster@hefce.ac.uk 2015-02-13T14:54:44+00:00 2015-02-13T14:54:44+00:00 Information published on the HEFCE web-site 9-13 February 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;65aff83c.1502 Information published on the HEFCE web-site 9-13 February 2015:<br><br>Web updates<br><br>Research and evaluation in progress<br>An update on the HEFCE-commissioned projects that are in progress.<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/pubs/rereports/researchandevaluationinprogress/<br><br>Blog posts<br><br>HEFCE 2015 conference: higher education and local growth<br>http://blog.hefce.ac.uk/2015/02/10/hefce-2015-conference-higher-education-and-local-growth/<br><br>Speculate to accumulate? You need to innovate to innovate<br>http://blog.hefce.ac.uk/2015/02/12/speculate-to-accumulate-you-need-to-innovate-to-innovate/<br><br>Deadlines<br><br>19 February Submit your views on the register of higher education providers<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/whatwedo/reg/register/ [...] Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-02-12T14:56:03+00:00 2015-02-12T14:56:03+00:00 Blog post: Speculate to accumulate? First at the lectern was Andy Street, Managing Director of the John Lewis Partnership and Chair of one of England's 39 local economic partnerships (LEPs). [...] p.foster@hefce.ac.uk 2015-02-06T14:38:29+00:00 2015-02-06T14:38:29+00:00 Information published on the HEFCE web-site 2-6 February 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;ed57feef.1502 Information published on the HEFCE web-site 2-6 February 2015:<br><br>News<br>The future of quality assessment in higher education: what approaches do other sectors and countries take?<br>HEFCE has published two studies to support our discussion with stakeholders about future approaches to quality assessment.<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,100748,en.html<br><br>HEFCE Business Plan 2015-2020 launched<br>HEFCE's Chief Executive, Professor Madeleine Atkins, has launched HEFCE's Business Plan 2015-2020 at the HEFCE 2015 Annual Conference at the University of London<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,100704,en.html [...] Shelley Hollingsworth (HEFCE) 2015-02-06T09:28:13+00:00 2015-02-06T09:28:13+00:00 The future of quality assessment in higher education: what approaches do other sectors and countries take? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;ddd102b1.1502 The future of quality assessment in higher education: what approaches do other sectors and countries take?<br><br>HEFCE has published two studies to support our discussion with stakeholders about future approaches to quality assessment.<br><br>HEFCE, together with the funding bodies in Wales and Northern Ireland, is undertaking a review of future approaches to quality assessment in higher education. In January we published a wide-ranging discussion document which asks important questions of higher education providers, of students, of employers, and of other stakeholders about what quality assessment arrangements should be like in the future. [...] p.foster@hefce.ac.uk 2015-02-06T08:34:03+00:00 2015-02-06T08:34:03+00:00 Further education colleges applying to become directly HEFCE funded: future quality requirements https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;6d74a8bd.1502 Further education colleges applying to become directly HEFCE funded: future quality requirements<br><br>From now on, HEFCE will only accept applications from colleges who wish to become directly funded if they have a recent and successful Quality Assessment Review conducted by the Quality Assurance Agency for Higher Education (QAA). This means that colleges will need to have had prior higher education experience in order to apply to be directly HEFCE funded.<br>Colleges with any unsatisfactory judgements recorded in their most recent review will need to meet either of the following conditions before submitting an application to HEFCE:<br>* if their most [...] Robert Stewart (HEFCE) 2015-02-05T12:09:58+00:00 2015-02-05T12:09:58+00:00 HEFCE Business Plan 2015-2020 launched https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;8f95173.1502 HEFCE Business Plan 2015-2020 launched<br><br>HEFCE's Chief Executive, Professor Madeleine Atkins, has today launched HEFCE's Business Plan 2015-2020 at the HEFCE 2015 Annual Conference at the University of London.<br><br>To read this item in full visit: http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,100704,en.html<br><br>Blog post: Looking ahead: HEFCE's Business Plan 2015 - 2020<br><br>Professor Madeleine Atkins introduces the new Business Plan.
